Label: Geotail Electric Field Detector, Key Parameters - K. Tsuruda (ISAS)

VariableDescription.Name: Es
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Electric Field from spherical  probe, sunwd & duskwd comp
VariableDescription.Header:
# ******************************************************* 
#  WARNING: Increase time period selected for listing. 
# ******************************************************* 
# 
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           ISTP Test of CDF format
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     GEOTAIL>Geomagnetic tail
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key parameter
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     DESCRIPTOR                      EFD>Electric Field Detector
#     TEXT                            Geotail Prelaunch Report, April 1992
#     MODS                            Version 1.0 Jan. 12, 1993
#                                     Modified on 7/18/94 and 7/29/94 by JT
#                                     Modified on 9/9/94 by JT - KPGS CCR 0039
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0089
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 GE_K0_EFD_00000000_V01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  GE_K0_EFD
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Geotail Electric Field Detector, Key Parameters
#     PI_NAME                         K. Tsuruda
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  ISAS
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Geotail
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Electric Fields (space)
#     TEXT_SUPPLEMENT_1               The sensor providing data here (called EFD-P in report above) measures the difference                  
#                                      of electric potential between two electrodes (probes) immersed in the plasma.                         
#                                     There are two sperical probes and two wire antennas each of which is extended                          
#                                      by 50 meters from the satellite in its rotational plane.                                              
#                                     The two sperical probes are opposite each other (100 meters tip-to-tip) as are                         
#                                      the two wire antennas. The probe pairs are orthogonal to each other.                                  
#                                     Diving the potential difference by the distance between the probes or the centers                      
#                                      of the conducting portion of the wire antennas gives the electric field component                     
#                                      along the probe extension.                                                                            
#                                     The measurement of the electric field in the satellite rotational plane gives                          
#                                      the vector electric field when the electric field along the magnetic field                            
#                                      is much smaller than the perpendicular component.                                                     
#     NSSDC_ID                        sphe-00654
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Geotail_EFD_Electric-Fields-Key-Parameters-K0_1min_cdf
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:47:27 2015
